bFSHDblock Struct Reference

File System Header Block Struct This block contains information on how to lauch the task which will manage the filesystem. You don't need it to reach partitions. More...

Detailed Description

File System Header Block Struct This block contains information on how to lauch the task which will manage the filesystem. You don't need it to reach partitions.

Field Documentation

ULONG bFSHDblock::checksum
 

008
Checksum.

char bFSHDblock::dosType[4]
 

020: "DOS" and OFS/FFS DIRCACHE INTL bits.

long bFSHDblock::flags
 

014
Flags.

long bFSHDblock::globalVec
 

04c
BCPL global vector when starting task (= -1).

long bFSHDblock::handler
 

038
Filename to loadseg (= 0).

long bFSHDblock::hostID
 

00c
SCSI Target ID of host (often 7).

char bFSHDblock::id[4]
 

000
"FSHD".

long bFSHDblock::lock
 

034
Not used (= 0).

short bFSHDblock::majVersion
 

024
Filesystem major version number. 0x0027001b == 39.27.

short bFSHDblock::minVersion
 

026
Filesystem minor version number.

long bFSHDblock::next
 

010
Block number of next FileSysHeaderBlock.

long bFSHDblock::patchFlags
 

028
Bits set for any of the following items that need to be substituted into a standard device node for this filesystem e.g. 0x180 to substitute SegList and GlobalVec.

long bFSHDblock::priority
 

040
Task priority when starting task (= 0).

long bFSHDblock::r1[2]
 

018
RESERVED.

050
RESERVED.

long bFSHDblock::r3[21]
 

0ac
RESERVED.

long bFSHDblock::segListBlock
 

048
First of linked list of LoadSegBlocks. Note that this entry requires some processing before substitution.

long bFSHDblock::size
 

004
Size (= 64).

long bFSHDblock::stackSize
 

03c
Stack size to use when starting task (=0).

044
Startup message (= 0).

long bFSHDblock::task
 

030
Standard DOS "task" field (= 0).

Device node type (= 0).
